Detailed Description

A validator for QPoint values.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TValueValidator::EValidateResult [inherited]

Enumerator:
VR_BAD  means that validation has failed.
VR_OK  means that validation has passed.
VR_FIXED  means that validated value has corrected automatically during validation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

int  xmin = INT_MIN,
int  xmax = INT_MAX,
int  ymin = INT_MIN,
int  ymax = INT_MAX 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
xmin is the minimum allowed x value, INT_MIN by default.
xmax is the maximum allowed x value, INT_MAX by default.
ymin is the minimum allowed y value, INT_MIN by default.
ymax is the maximum allowed y value, INT_MAX by default.

Member Function Documentation

virtual EValidateResult TPointValidator::checkValue ( QVariant &  value  )  [virtual]

This method checks input (normally passed from item editor) and returns a result of the validation (see EValidateResult enum).

If the validator can fix invalid value, it should write correct value back to and return VR_FIXED. If the value can not be fixed, it should return VR_BAD. If the value is good, it should return VR_OK respectively.

Implements TValueValidator.

Member Data Documentation

TPointValidator* TPointValidator::s_PointValidator [static]

Standard point input validator.
